definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The 7th China-EU Leaders' Meeting will take place on the following day there.
sentences.chinese: 第七次中歐領導人會晤將於8日在這裏舉行。

sentences.english: All of these issues will be on the agenda tomorrow when I meet with President Hu.
sentences.chinese: 我明天與胡主席會晤時，會就上述所有問題交換看法。

sentences.english: In order to assuage these worries, the meeting must produce tangible achievements.
sentences.chinese: 爲了緩和這些憂慮，會晤必須產生切實的成就。

sentences.english: During the meetings, President Hu Jintao will hold bilateral meetings with leaders of some members.
sentences.chinese: 會議期間，胡主席將與部分成員領導人舉行雙邊會晤。

sentences.english: It gives me great pleasure to meet all of you again in the beautiful city of Ufa.
sentences.chinese: 很高興在美麗的烏法同大家再次會晤。

sentences.english: Steve had been meeting with the bankers in separate groups .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫分頭去和一批批的銀行家會晤。

sentences.english: The EU expressed gratitude to the Jiangsu Province for hosting the summit.
sentences.chinese: 歐方領導人對會晤舉辦地江蘇省表示感謝。

sentences.english: Their advisers scheduled the meeting soon after Rousseff won the presidential elections.
sentences.chinese: 就在羅賽芙獲選後不久，雙方顧問就安排了會晤。

sentences.english: Chacon said she was "extremely optimistic" about the Berlin meeting.
sentences.chinese: 查孔說，她對此次柏林會晤“非常樂觀”。

sentences.english: That meeting led to an unprecedented détente on the divided Korean Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 此次會晤爲朝鮮半島創造出前所未有的緩和局勢。

sentences.english: Will Chinese leaders consider holding the first meeting with Prime Minister Noda?
sentences.chinese: 中國領導人是否考慮與野田首相舉行首次會晤？

sentences.english: But Chinese leaders believe such dialogue belongs behind closed doors.
sentences.chinese: 但是中國領導人認爲，這種對話屬於祕密會晤。

sentences.english: First, do you have any comment on the Kaesong meeting between the DPRK and the ROK?
sentences.chinese: 第一，你對朝韓開城會晤有何評論？

sentences.english: He inquired for his little country woman of Mrs. Glass, but without requesting to see her.
sentences.chinese: 他向格拉斯太太問起他的小同鄉，但沒有要求會晤她。

sentences.english: In Nixon's tenure, the United States held three Soviet summit.
sentences.chinese: 在尼克松任期內，美蘇共舉行了三次首腦會晤。

sentences.english: On your third question, obviously, the current atmosphere is unsuitable for such a meeting.
sentences.chinese: 第三個問題，當前的氣氛顯然不適合舉行這樣的會晤。

definition: to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to meet with (sb who is paying a visit)/CL:次[ci4]
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
